did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.physdesc: This collection consists of ca. 4,000 items.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Access is controlled by the depositor or his designee. Those wishing access to the collection must furnish the Director of Special Collections a memorandum outlining their academic background, scope of project, importance of this collection to that project and any publication plans. The Director will forward the request to the depositor or, in his absence, his designee, Doreen Gildroy.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of Michael Ryan, Accession #10963, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was loaned to the University of Virginia Library by Michael Ryan of Santa Monica, California, on June 21, 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of American poet Michael Ryan (1946- ), ca. 4,000 items (21 Hollinger boxes, and 1 cubic of printed material, 8 linear feet), 1957-1990, containing correspondence; manuscripts of articles, poems, and books, both by Michael Ryan and others; printed material; cassette tapes of poetry readings by Michael Ryan; and notebooks, examinations, and papers pertaining to Ryan's undergraduate years at the University of Notre Dame.

Ryan was educated at the University of Notre Dame (A.B. 1968), Claremont Graduate School (M.A. 1970), and the University of Iowa (M.F.A. 1972; Ph.D. 1974). He has taught in the Creative Writing Programs and English Departments of the University of Iowa, Southern Methodist University, Goddard College, Princeton University, and Warren Wilson College, as well as giving some lectures at the University of Virginia. Some of the awards and honors that Ryan has received include: the Yale Series of Younger Poets Award, Texas Institute of Letters Prize, and Nominee, National Book Award, all for Threats Instead of Trees (1973, 1974); Fellowship in Creative Writing, National Endowment for the Arts (1976-1977); Residence, Yaddo (1975 & 1977); the Virginia Prize for Poetry from Virginia Commission for the Arts for God Hunger (1987); the Whiting Writing Award (1987); and the Emily Clark Balch Prize for Poetry, for "Meeting Cheever" (1989).

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: The first series of this collection consists of the literary manuscripts of Michael Ryan, divided into three subseries: books; articles, lectures, etc.; and poetry. The books subseries includes the manuscripts for his University of Iowa thesis "The Blind Swimmer;" his books of poetry including God Hunger(1989), In Winter(1981), and Threats Instead of Trees(1974); and an unfinished novel. Ryan's articles and lectures concerning poetry are arranged alphabetically by title and include publication in such periodicals as The New England Review & Breadloaf Quarterly, The American Poetry Review, Crazyhorse Poetry and Prose, and Poetry. Also in the second subseries are interviews with Stanley Kunitz and Alan Dugan and an introduction for Ann Beattie and Raymond Carver.

The last subseries includes individual poems by Michael Ryan, each foldered separately and arranged alphabetically by title. The numerous working drafts present for many of Ryan's poems will benefit anyone seeking to study Ryan's method of poetry composition.
The second series contains poetry, short stories, essays, a novel, and articles submitted to Ryan by his friends and colleagues for advice, comments and literary criticism.

Correspondence with friends, colleagues, and other contemporary poets comprises the third series. Correspondents with several letters to their credit have their own folder and are listed in the box listing; those with less material have been filed alphabetically in general correspondence folders but have also been listed in the box listing.

The fourth series of topical and miscellaneous material contains personal papers, biographical information concerning Ryan, legal papers, grant applications, printed material, papers concerning Ryan's part- time work at the MFA Writing Program at Warren Wilson College, and papers pertaining to Ryan's undergraduate work at the University of Notre Dame. Papers in this series relating to his literary career include a copy of his own comments about his poetry to Stanley Kunitz, comments regarding In Winterand God Hunger, and cassettes of Ryan reading and discussing his own poetry in Ohio, Arizona, Virginia, and elsewhere.
